intro: Toxocarpus villosus, commonly known as the hairy toxocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Toxocarpus villosus is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
